===The Yes Camp ===
===The Yes Camp ===
{{expand section|date=March 2011}}
{{expand section|date=March 2011}}
â
The [[Muslim Brotherhood]] and the [[Salafi]] movement, among other Islamist groups in Egypt, think that the amendments are suitable for the time being and that the situation in Egypt is not perfect to write a new constitution right away. Sheikh [[Yusuf al-Qaradawi]] advised the Egyptians on the 18 of March to vote Yes on constitutional referendum.<ref>http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=422881&version=1&template_id=36&parent_id=16</ref> The [[National Democratic Party (Egypt)|NDP]] also have asked their base to vote Yes.
+
The [[Muslim Brotherhood]] and the [[Salafi]] movement, among other Islamist groups in Egypt, think that the amendments are suitable for the time being and that the situation in Egypt is not perfect to write a new constitution right away. They have used fear tactics saying that '''Article 2''' of the Constitution of Egypt (which states ''Islam is the Religion of the State. Arabic is its official language, and the principal source of legislation is Islamic Jurisprudence (Sharia)'') will removed or changed if they did not vote Yes. Sheikh [[Yusuf al-Qaradawi]] advised the Egyptians on the 18 of March to vote Yes on constitutional referendum.<ref>http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=422881&version=1&template_id=36&parent_id=16</ref> The [[National Democratic Party (Egypt)|NDP]] also have asked their base to vote Yes.
